oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Regional Activities of the Resettlement Administration
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Resettlement Administration was a New Deal program created in 1935 to relocate poor urban and rural families to planned communities created by the Federal Government. In 1937, it was made part of the Farm Security Administration.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States. Resettlement Administration; United States. Farm Security Administration; New Deal, 1933-1939; Depressions--1929---United States--Maps
Maps
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States. Resettlement Administration; United States. Farm Security Administration
